title: The Ethics of Killing: Problems at the Margins of Life, [Non-Fic
description:
This magisterial work is the first comprehensive study of the ethics of 
killing, where the moral status of the individual killed is uncertain. 
Drawing on philosophical notions of personal identity and the immorality
 of killing, McMahan looks carefully at a host of practical issues, 
including abortion, infanticide, the killing of animals, assisted 
suicide, and euthanasia.
